p.s: All organizations should have a crisis management policy which is at the same level of importance as the mission statement and business plan .
A proper crisis management policy can rapidly restore normality and confidence for workers in the organization .
It also provides a good source of PR material for the media .

item.s: Determine whether it is a crisis .
This question is important to ask , as there are many situations that go wrong because the right person to handle it is not around .
You may be in charge of a project until your supervisor comes back and are unable to contact him during a crisis .
You have to make your own decisions in his absence and your action is dependent on the level of authority given .

figure.rend: Create a Crisis Management Strategy Step 1.jpg

item.s: See the Big Picture .
It is not easy to handle a crisis if you are not aware of the all the facts .
The final outcome may not be the way you envisage .
If your role is a leader , you have to be detached from the emotional side of the crisis and rationally take stock of how to move on .
Again , this is not as easy as it sounds as you may have longtime colleagues who are involved in this crisis .

figure.rend: Create a Crisis Management Strategy Step 2.jpg

item.s: Gather the Relevant Team .
It is important to be able to meet up with the relevant team to discuss about the situation .
This is to ensure that the team is able to analyse and make a united stand about handling this crisis .
This team should also comprise of the authorities , if the crisis is serious .

figure.rend: Create a Crisis Management Strategy Step 3.jpg

item.s: Set a Timeline .
You must construct a timeline and ensure that each process scenario is highlighted .
This practice will be a check to prevent your team from spending too much time in one aspect of handling the crisis .

figure.rend: Create a Crisis Management Strategy Step 4.jpg

item.s: Develop a Procedural Manual .
Is there an organizational situational manual that you can use for this situation ? Are you able to recollect the tips that were given to you when you participated in a mock drill ?

figure.rend: Create a Crisis Management Strategy Step 5.jpg

item.s: Seek External Experts .
You should get external experts to access the situation if the crisis is totally unanticipated .
However , you must have had a close-door meeting with your inner circle .
This is essential , as you do not want to unnecessarily reveal confidential information to external parties .

figure.rend: Create a Crisis Management Strategy Step 6.jpg

item.s: Speak To The Media .
It is important to prepare a press kit which provides a full detailed report about the crisis .
If you are comfortable to conduct a press interview , you have to ensure that you have the full details first .

figure.rend: Create a Crisis Management Strategy Step 7.jpg

item.s: Fine tune Your Communication Style .
You have to ensure that your communication style is in sync with the crisis .
Remember to be forthcoming with reliable information and try not to speculate .
This will also ensure that the victims ' immediate families do not overly worry .
It will also not help if you come across as very emotional in the media as you want to communicate that your organization has everything under control .

figure.rend: Create a Crisis Management Strategy Step 8.jpg

item.s: Protect your reputation .
If the crisis involves the loss of lives , it is not unthinkable that your credibility and organisation 's reputation is put into question .
Assuming that the crisis was beyond your organisation 's control , you have to stick to your best judgement and not be led into a debate that may open your organisation to possible legal action .
